About Our College

M. L. Dahanukar College of Commerce (Autonomous)

Parle Tilak Vidyalaya Association (PTVA) was established in 1921 to commemorate Lokmanya Tilak by undertaking educational activities. Over the past 102 years, the Institution has grown into a large educational organisation with two Primary schools, two Secondary schools, one English medium and one ICSE school. The Institution also has to its credit three Junior Colleges, three Degree Colleges affiliated to University of Mumbai with Under Graduate, Post Graduate Courses . The institute also runs an AICTE approved Institute of Management offering Post Graduate Diploma and Degree courses in Management. Nearly 27,000 students benefit from the altruism of the Institution. Parle Commerce College was established in June 1960 under the parasol of PTVA. A handsome donation made by Shri Mahadev Laxman Dahanukar, a philanthropic industrialist resulted in the College being renamed as M.L. Dahanukar College of Commerce in 1962. PTVA's M. L. Dahanukar College of Commerce has completed 65 Glorious Years in the field of education and is accredited with 'B+' Grade by NAAC.

NAAC Accredited
5000+ Students
150+ Faculty
60+ Years Legacy
